snippet: The agency stopped short of declaring a global health emergency, but suggested drastically expanding vaccination programs.
abstract: World Health Organization recommends broadening vaccination efforts to counter outbreak of yellow fever in Africa; outbreak traced to Angola has killed 300 people and comes as much of world's attention and resources are already committted to fighting South America's Zika epidemic.
lead_paragraph: The agency stopped short of declaring a global health emergency, but suggested drastically expanding vaccination programs.

headline.main: W.H.O. Calls Yellow Fever in Africa ‘Serious Concern’
headline.print_headline: W.H.O. Calls Yellow Fever ‘Serious Concern’ in Africa
